span: Phone not working at all - Do not Buy!!!
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2026
review-text: Since shortly after purchase, the device has had serious and persistent performance issues that make it unreliable for basic daily use. Specifically: • GPS functionality fails approximately 90% of the time • Cellular reception is extremely poor or nonexistent, despite the fact that I live in a city where normal cellular coverage is strong and reliable • I cannot reliably make calls, use navigation, or access mobile data—even in areas where reception should not be an issue These are fundamental functions of a smartphone, and the failure of both GPS and cellular reception has made this device unusable for its intended purpose. This has caused ongoing inconvenience, wasted time, and significant frustration.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2026
review-text: 0 stars if i could. Phone was in great shape but Not unlocked as it was stated. Seller did not want to make situation right  and i was forced to return for full refund (pending). Spent almost 2 hours of my time transferring data and calling my carrier technical support only to find it was not unlocked. Luckily my old phone still works and could re-connect. I would stay away from this seller and read the most recent reviews before  making a purchase. Especially if you do not have another phone to switch back to.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2026
review-text: Phone was supposed to be unlocked.  Got this phone to upgrade my older Galaxy S9. Newer phone use a digital Simm card instead of a physical card. So once I tried to activate this S24 that was actually locked it canceled my physical Simm card. I was left with no working phone. I was forced to either buy another Simm card or buy a phone from my carrier.  I couldn't wait weeks to gamble if another "unlocked" phone was actually unlocked.  So this whole purchase was horrible and very inconvenient.  Don't fall for the same mistake.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2025
review-text: I purchased this phone on Amazon. Apparently it is fulfilled by a third party. I received the phone and transferred my SIM card from old phone to the new phone and could not make or receive calls. I tried to switch the SIM card back to my old phone and could not use that phone anymore. I went to the Verizon store and was told my account was suspended because the device ID came back to a stolen phone or one that had a unpaid balance associated with it and it could not be activated. It was a real hassle to get my account unlocked. It was kind of a nightmare. I also had to pay $20.00 dollars to ship it back to them, for a phone they should have known had issues, and they may change me a restocking fee!

span: Locked phone while advert syas UNlocked!
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2026
review-text: It appears it isn't an unlocked phone. But the selling advert telling otherwise. This refurbished phone is working good, but it would be more helpfull if the phone was unlocked. To bad we cannot trust what is written in the advert!

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2025
review-text: The phone is good, but the phone is listed as "Unlocked" but was in fact carrier locked to Spectrum and unusable. Very disappointing as I was in urgent need for a new phone, and waiting several days for shipping only to find out it's not unlocked as advertised is unacceptable.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2025
review-text: UNFAIR RESTOCKING FEE. The phone was in excellent condition yet it would drop the network signal consistently. I was unable to make calls out or take calls. I also had issues with audio and apps dropping signals. I returned the phone and the seller charged me a $379.99 restocking fee. The seller said the return phone had a screen lock and I wouldn't get a refund until I  send them my security screen lock pattern code. I informed the seller that I had factory reset the phone twice before sending it back. After communicating with seller I went into the accounts I used to set up that phone and it showed that I didn't install a pattern lock on that phone. It also showed that I was signed out from all activity on that phone. Seller has refused to refund me the $379.99.

span: Fraud phone is locked and will never recieve rom updates
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2025
review-text: Total scam, this S24 is S921U reference that is for carrier. And seem the ROM got botched to show unlocked. Samsung won't update it for security and it's a major issue for product life. Patch is locked at August 1st 2024. Samsung is not helping. Neither any one. And I don't understand how AMAZON sell this as renewed as this total fraud.

span: 5 Months in and the phone has broken
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2025
review-text: 5 months after buying the phone, it turned off and never turned back on. It seems like an issue with the battery being faulty, but it is now out of the 90 day refurbished warranty period and the money is wasted on a bricked phone.

span: Phone not in excellent condition as described - screen deeply scratched
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2025
review-text: Was not in excellent condition as stated. There are two deep scratches that are very noticeable in the middle of the screen. Phone's bottom left edge is also damaged.
